Pre-Game Insights: Australia will take on England in the Group B match of the T20 World Cup 2024 at the Kensington Oval in Barbados.
Australia, the former champions from 2021, will be coming into this match after their 39-run win against Oman in their tournament opener.
England are yet to kickstart their campaign as their opener was washed out against Scotland.
The pitch at the Kensington Oval in the T20 World Cup 2024 has provided assistance to the fast bowlers and spinners alike.
The average first innings score of 151 at this venue in T20Is could prove to be quite a competitive total when Australia takes on England.
Mitchell Marsh has been handed the responsibility to lead the Australian team at the T20 World Cup 2024.
Key players for Australia include David Warner, Travis Head, Marcus Stoinis, Mitchell Starc, Pat Cummins, and Adam Zampa.
The England captain, Jos Buttler, and his opening partner Phil Salt will have the responsibility to provide quick starts in the powerplay overs.
In the bowling department, Jofra Archer will be playing a key role of the enforcer, with crucial contributions from Mark Wood and Adil Rashid.
